column1: 0;essay01.txt;Should students be taught to compete or to cooperate?;"It is always said that competition can effectively promote the development of economy. In order to survive in the competition
column2: companies continue to improve their products and service
column3: and as a result
column4: the whole society prospers. However
column5: when we discuss the issue of competition or cooperation
column6: what we are concerned about is not the whole society
column7: but the development of an individual's whole life. From this point of view
column8: I firmly believe that we should attach more importance to cooperation during primary education.

column2: through cooperation
column3: children can learn about interpersonal skills which are significant in the future life of all students. What we acquired from team work is not only how to achieve the same goal with others but more importantly
column4: how to get along with others. During the process of cooperation
column5: children can learn about how to listen to opinions of others
column6: how to communicate with others
column7: how to think comprehensively
column8: and even how to compromise with other team members when conflicts occurred. All of these skills help them to get on well with other people and will benefit them for the whole life.

column2: the significance of competition is that how to become more excellence to gain the victory. Hence it is always said that competition makes the society more effective. However
column3: when we consider about the question that how to win the game
column4: we always find that we need the cooperation. The greater our goal is
column5: the more competition we need. Take Olympic games which is a form of competition for instance
column6: it is hard to imagine how an athlete could win the game without the training of his or her coach
column7: and the help of other professional staffs such as the people who take care of his diet
column8: and those who are in charge of the medical care. The winner is the athlete but the success belongs to the whole team. Therefore without the cooperation
column9: there would be no victory of competition.

column2: no matter from the view of individual development or the relationship between competition and cooperation we can receive the same conclusion that a more cooperative attitudes towards life is more profitable in one's success.";"Education is not only about acquiring knowledge
column3: but also about developing the skills and attitudes necessary to succeed in life. One of the most important decisions in education is whether students should be taught to compete or to cooperate.

column2: competition is often seen as a way to motivate students to work harder and achieve more. By pitting students against one another
column3: it is believed that they will be pushed to excel and develop important skills such as resilience
column4: determination
column5: and strategic thinking. In a competitive environment
column6: students may also learn to be independent and self-reliant
column7: which are valuable traits in the real world.

column2: cooperation is equally important in preparing students for their future. By working together
column3: students learn to communicate
column4: share ideas
column5: and build relationships. Cooperation also helps to promote empathy and respect for others
column6: as students learn to appreciate the strengths and weaknesses of their peers. Furthermore
column7: in many industries and careers
column8: collaboration and teamwork are essential for success
column9: and students who are not taught to cooperate may struggle to adapt to these environments.

column2: both competition and cooperation have their advantages and disadvantages
column3: and both are important skills for students to develop. However
column4: it is essential that educators strike a balance between the two
column5: teaching students when to compete and when to cooperate
column6: and providing opportunities to practice both skills. Ultimately
column7: the goal should be to prepare students for the diverse and complex challenges they will face in the future
column8: whether they arise from competition or cooperation.";"The contemporary education system frequently grapples with the question of whether students should be taught to compete or cooperate. Striking the right balance is essential
column9: as both competition and cooperation have their merits in shaping a well-rounded individual.

column1: Competition can act as a powerful motivator
column2: pushing students to excel and surpass their perceived limitations. It fosters a spirit of resilience
column3: adaptability
column4: and innovation
column5: as learners strive to outperform their peers. Moreover
column6: competition prepares students for real-world challenges
column7: where they are bound to encounter similar competitive scenarios in their professional lives.

column2: solely focusing on competition can lead to excessive stress
column3: anxiety
column4: and unhealthy rivalry
column5: which may hinder students' personal and academic growth. This is where the value of cooperation becomes apparent. By teaching students to cooperate
column6: educators encourage essential skills like teamwork
column7: communication
column8: empathy
column9: and problem-solving. These skills are indispensable in today's increasingly interconnected world
column10: where success often depends on the ability to collaborate with others.

column2: the ideal education system should strike a balance between competition and cooperation. While competition nurtures a drive for excellence and adaptability
column3: cooperation fosters critical interpersonal skills and mutual support. By integrating both elements
column4: educators can help shape well-rounded individuals who are prepared to excel in their personal and professional lives."

column5: in turn

column2: although there are opposing ideas of neglecting oneâs cultural values to adapt in the new cultures. As far as I am concerned
column3: sustaining the traditions will make the immigrated people keep their cultural identity and give them confident among the many culture society.";"Migration has been a part of human history for centuries. However
column4: in recent times

column1: There are various reasons why people choose to migrate to other countries. Some people migrate to improve their economic prospects. They may be seeking better job opportunities or a higher standard of living. Others may migrate to escape political unrest
column2: conflict
column3: or persecution in their home country. Some may migrate for educational opportunities or to be closer to family members who have already migrated.

column1: Globalization and advances in transportation and communication technology have also made it easier for people to migrate. In addition

column1: While migration can bring many benefits

column4: and discrimination in their new country. They may also face challenges in adapting to a new environment and integrating into the local community.

column2: the influx of migrants can put pressure on host countries

column2: the trend of migration to other countries is likely to continue
column3: driven by a range of factors. While migration can bring many benefits
column4: it also presents challenges. It is important for countries to develop policies that balance the benefits and challenges of migration

column2: individuals from developing countries seek to improve their lives by migrating to these prosperous regions. Furthermore
column3: the increasing accessibility of information and communication technologies has made it easier for people to research and connect with opportunities abroad.

column2: political instability and environmental challenges are also key contributors to the rise in migration. War
column3: persecution
column4: and human rights violations compel individuals to seek refuge in safer countries. Likewise

column6: forcing inhabitants to search for more stable environments.

column1: The escalating rate of global migration presents both challenges and opportunities. Host countries face issues such as cultural integration
column2: resource allocation

column5: economic growth

column2: the surge in global migration is a multifaceted phenomenon

column4: it is crucial to adopt policies that maximize the benefits of migration while mitigating its potential drawbacks."

column1: 5;essay06.txt;Why you should exercise;"More than 1.6 billion people in the world are either overweight or obese and United States has the highest rate of obesity. America's number one killer is cardiovascular diseases
column2: which can easily be prevented by exercising. Exercise not only reduces the risk of health problems and various diseases
column3: but it also has an effect on overall appearance. It is proven that exercising and being active can improve self-esteem and confidence. Excerising is one of the most important things in life and it can even be fun. It is a crucial element for living a healthier
column4: longer
column5: and happier life.

column1: The number one reason why people should exercise is because it will keep you healthy. Americans are eating enormous amounts of fast foods these days
column2: so cardiovascular diseases are becoming more and more common. One out of every four Americans are suffering from some form of cardiovascular diseases
column3: which results in more than forty-five percent of deaths annually. The main cause for this condition is obesity. The more body fat that you have
column4: the greater your risk for heart disease. However
column5: this condition can easily be prevented or controlled by exercising. Exercising makes the heart muscles stronger. When your heart muscle is strong it can do the same amount of work at a lower heart rate

column7: so many serious illnesses are becoming quite common. Exercising not only helps prevent cardiovascular diseases
column8: but it also helps prevent strokes
column9: type 2 diabetes
column10: and even certain types of cancer.

column1: The second benefit to exercising is that it improves self-esteem and confidence. Most people think of exercising as only being a physical activity
column2: but it's also a mental activity. There have been studies that show evidence that people who exercise have higher self esteem and confidence. It also showed that active people are less likely to have depression and anxiety. Exercising gives people energy

column4: which are chemicals that create a happy feeling in brain. Plus
column5: when you're exercising you're bringing more oxygen into you lungs and your brain appreciates the extra air. Exercising also helps improve you brain function and your memory.

column1: In my opinion the best reason to exercise is that it's really fun! Most people think that exercising takes up a lot of time and it requires too much work. When people actually take the time to try exercising they realize it's an enjoyable experience. It doesn't matter how you exercise
column2: as long as you are being active. Everyone enjoys different sports or activities

Setting goals and rewards will help you stay motivated and consistent with exercising. There is no greater feeling than achieving a weight lose goal and being able to feel good about your body. It makes exercising well worth it.

column2: exercising is the key to making your life healthier
column3: longer
column4: and happier. It is one of the most important things in life and it's one hundred percent beneficial. Many people come up with plenty of excuses to not exercise; however
column5: if you truly want to improve your mental and physical health you will find the energy and time to exercise. Everyone should take time out of their days to exercise
column6: so they can improve their lives in many ways. So next time you are deciding whether or not to exercise just think of the benefits you will experience from it. It is extremely rewarding and worthwhile.";"Exercise is essential for maintaining good health and well-being. column1: 8;essay09.txt;The Truth About Cannabis;"Is marijuana as bad as society makes it out to be? Since the 1930's marijuana has been illegal in the United States. column2: when allowed
